original_prompt: In this task, you are given a tuple, comprising Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether, as a result of the Head, PersonX will be seen as what is mentioned in the Tail or not. In this task, PersonX will be seen as the Tail if the Tail describes PersonX's persona or attribute as perceived by others given an event. In the gift-giving example, X may be seen as generous or giving. In contrast, in an event such as PersonX steals a car, PersonX may be perceived as evil. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.

PersonX will be seen as the Tail if the Tail describes PersonX's persona or attribute as perceived by others given an event. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", which can represent an object, a person, and/or an action.

In this task, you are given a tuple, which includes two phrases separated by <sep>, Head and Tail. The phrases involve participants and their names are replaced with generic words (e.g. PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event in the tuple. Your task is to determine if, as a result of the Head event, PersonX will be perceived as mentioned in the Tail or not. The Tail phrase must describe PersonX's persona or attribute as perceived by others due to the event in the Head. For example, if the Head phrase is PersonX gives a gift, then the Tail phrase may be seen as PersonX being generous or giving. If the Head phrase is PersonX steals a car, then the Tail phrase may be perceived as PersonX being evil. You have to classify your answers as either "Yes" or "No". The phrase may also contain "___", which can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
